Articles.Content:
I recently installed Xubuntu 14.04 LTS just for the ability to run a 64 bit version of KSP because my modlist is too large for the 32 bit RAM limit. My problem is that I can load the game and use the VAB but when I hit launch it goes to loading and then just dumps me back to the desktop with no warning. I can not post the log because for some reason it has not generated one since last night. I have tested it with a stock install using the 64 bit version and it works fine. The problem appears to be with a mod. The question is: which one? I have over 90 installed so it will take a while to isolate it. If anyone has had this problem before and could shed some light on it I'd appreciate it.

Do you know how to run a program from the terminal?

Open a terminal, type cd then space. Next drag the entire ksp folder into the terminal, it should automatically fill in the directory path. hit enter, now you should be in the ksp folder. next type ./KSP.x86_64 then hit enter, any startup errors should be listed at the bottom.

Do you know how to run a program from the terminal?

Open a terminal, type cd then space. Next drag the entire ksp folder into the terminal, it should automatically fill in the directory path. hit enter, now you should be in the ksp folder. next type ./KSP.x86_64 then hit enter, any startup errors should be listed at the bottom.

I got this:

david@david-GA-880GM-USB3:~/.steam/steam/steamapps/common/Kerbal Space Program$ ./KSP.x86_64Set current directory to /home/david/.steam/steam/steamapps/common/Kerbal Space Program
Found path: /home/david/.steam/steam/steamapps/common/Kerbal Space Program/KSP.x86_64
Mono path[0] = '/home/david/.steam/steam/steamapps/common/Kerbal Space Program/KSP_Data/Managed'
Mono path[1] = '/home/david/.steam/steam/steamapps/common/Kerbal Space Program/KSP_Data/Mono'
Mono config path = '/home/david/.steam/steam/steamapps/common/Kerbal Space Program/KSP_Data/Mono/etc'
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
david@david-GA-880GM-USB3:~/.steam/steam/steamapps/common/Kerbal Space Program$
hmm Segmentation fault is very ugly thing. Which graphic card do you use?

hmm Segmentation fault is very ugly thing. Which graphic card do you use?

A Radeon 6970. Are you thinking drivers or a bad card?

areÃ¯Â¿Â¼ the drivers the last ones? I don't know how the situation now is but 10 years ago ATI drivers were very unstable. but on the other hand, are you sure you have the 64 bit version installed, what tells you uname -a ?
I haven't installed any drivers. I'm only using the stock ubuntu ones. I do have 64 bit ksp. I'm running the one marked 64.

As far as I know are the opensource drivers not feature-complete, you need the vendor driver, see here https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BinaryDriverHowto/AMD

Edited October 14, 2015 by WeirdCulture

As far as I know are the opensource drivers not feature-complete, you need the vendor driver, see here https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BinaryDriverHowto/AMD

I keep reading that the vendor drivers are buggy. Has that situation changed?

The old fglrx drivers from the repository is a bit rough, yes, the open source radeon driver is actually better in most cases.

The Catalyst driver from the AMD website is your best bet though.

I finally got the Catalyst drivers installed(that was a real joke BTW) I'm still getting the core dump. Any more thoughts or should I just start gutting my mods until the thing works? KSP actually created logs today so here they are https://www.dropbox.com/sh/20olmmt8obhaxd4/AAAoEsyth7L7Cp2L-yVOTS3Ba?dl=0
